column2: Hi there what are you doing ?
column3: Hey I'm fine.
column4: How are you doing?
column5: I am doing really good.
column6: So, what are you up to today?
column7: I've been thinking about donating to a children's charity.
column8: I can't decide which onne.
column9: I was going to ask you if you would be interested in donating to Save the Children.
column10: How do you feel about this charity?
column11: I have heard about it but I can't remember it's mission.
column12: Do you know that charity's mission?
column13: They provide kids with the basic things they need like food and clothing.
column14: I really like their mission.
column15: I really feel badly for the kids.
column16: Don't you?
column17: Yes, it tugs at my heart to think of all of those children.
column18: Do you know where the charity is headquatered?
column19: They are based in CT.
column20: I feel that it would be easy to donate.
column21: I know I spend on little things like a candy bar or gum.
column22: I know I could give up spending on this and it would help the kids.
column23: Could you donate anything to them?
column24: yes I can.
column25: I can donate 10 dollars.
column26: Wow!
column27: that is so great.
column28: Thank you so much.
column29: Are you hoping that the money goes to a certain cause like food or clothes?
column30: OH, yeah food please.
column31: Gotta feed the hungry first
column32: Yes!
column33: I think that is a great idea.
column34: I am glad you decided to be part of this really great cause.
column35: Have you ever donated to a charity before this?
column36: no this is my first time.
column37: what do I do now?
column38: You do not have to do anything else.
column39: I am really glad that you donated.
column40: What are your other plans for the day today?
column41: WOW, I was just going to ask you the same thing.
column42: I plan on doing some more surveys, then taking a drive up on the parkway and have a picnic.
column43: Yes, I also plan on having a day of fun too.
column44: I am hoping to find some photo albums and get those worked on.
column45: Do you still get printed pictures or do you do all digital pictures?
column46: Printed pictures all the way for me, it's what I know.
column47: What kind of camera do you have?
column48: I have a really old digital camera.
column49: I also have a smartphone, but I am thinking about getting a newer one.
column50: I have heard the cameras on the new smartphones are good.
column51: Do you have a smartphone that takes good pictures?
column52: Yeah, I have one, but I don't use the camera.
column53: I have an old Nikon 360 camera that takes film.
column54: Do you have anything like that?

column7: Tell me as much as you can about the organization.
column8: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
column9: It sounds like they have a worthy cause.
column10: Do they help our children in the US as well?
column11: This is a charity for children that are victims of war and hard times.
column12: For children in developing countries, especially in war zones.
column13: For instance, millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence.
column14: In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence.
column15: Wow, it is great that these children have a charity to help them.
column16: Very much so!

column24: Yes!

column3: Hello
column4: Looks like there might be a bonus coming at the end of this HIT, have you got any plans for the money?
column5: Nope, what do you recommend?
column6: I read a lot about the Save the Children charity before I came in here.
column7: I hope that more people will donate a portion of their income.
column8: Even small amounts will definitely help
column9: What's Save the Children all about?
column10: They provide relief and support to children in developing nations, especially the millions of kids who are at risk in Syria.
column11: They are a charity we can trust, so I think we all should do our part to help the less fortunate
column12: Do they provide for the millions of hungry kids here in the USA?
column13: They concentrate on developing countries, but, personally, I think that there is just as great a need abroad as there is at home
column14: Yeah, i think an American charity should focus on America too
column15: That's true, but we're all in this together, as they say.
column16: People far away need help just as much as people close to us.
column17: You could even take the money that you want to give to charity and split it in half among American and international relief agencies
column18: That would work best for me.
column19: That way i know where my money is going.
column20: Is there a minimum to donate?
column21: No, there is no minimum that I've ever heard of.
column22: They know that any small amount can help.
column23: That's great!
column24: Is there a website where i can donate?
column25: I'm glad to hear it!
column26: Save the Children do have a website at  URL
column27: You can learn more about them there, but there's an easier way to donate
column28: What is the easier way?
column29: The researchers behind this HIT are gathering up donations so that they can give the money to the charity all at once.
column30: The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children.
column31: It must save time and transaction fees for the charity that way.
column32: That's interesting and sounds good, right?
column33: Yeah, it does sound good.
column34: Of course it's your decision, in the end.
column35: I am kind of curious about the details though.
column36: How much do you like to donate to the charity now?
column37: The researchers will let you donate anything up to the amount of your total task payment.
column38: Or nothing, if that's what you decide.
column39: I think i will make a donation of $2
column40: That's wonderful!
column41: I think I'm getting eager to see what happens next with the research and the charity, so I'm about to move on.
column42: It was great chatting with you.
column43: And thanks for helping!
column45: I think I'm getting eager to see what happens next with the research and the charity, so I'm about to move on.
column46: It was great chatting with you.

column6: Yes, so I think it is a good idea to donate to the childrens charity.

column8: I am volunteering for the charity called Save the Children.
column9: Are you familiar with them?
column10: No I am not.
column11: Can you tell me about it?
column12: They promote children's rights and help support kids in developing countries.
column13: It takes so little money to help feed a starving child.
column14: What can I do to help?
column15: I'm so glad you asked!
column16: One thing you could do is agree to contribute what you make just from this one task we are doing right now.
column17: Ok how much do you need?
column18: If you pledge to contribute the reward from this task, that will feed a starving child for a full day!
column19: Isn't that amazing?
column20: That is awesome but I need the money so I can't afford to give right now.
column21: I know what you mean, I need to make money too.
column22: But at the same time, here we are in front of our computers, and we can work all day to make up the small amount we will contribute.
column23: I can't work all day.
column24: I have to take care of my disable family member and I really can't afford it.
column25: Oh I'm so sorry to hear that.
column26: I have problems too.
column27: But as little as $1 can feed a child for the whole day.
column28: I don't know about you, but I could find $1 in change just lying around the house.
column29: No matter how big our problems are, we are not going to starve for lack of a dollar...
column30: I have 10 cents I can give.
column31: That's awesome and generous!
column32: Thank you for doing this.
column33: I will also give money today.
column34: Believe it or not, 10 cents makes a difference in a child's life!
column35: Wonderful.
column36: I am so happy I can help.
column37: Thank you again.
column38: If you would like to learn more about Save the Children, check out their website.

column2: Hello ! How were you all today ?
column3: I'm doing very well thank you!
column4: How is your day going so far?
column5: I am doing well.
column6: My day has been busy visiting different places to speak about the charity I support.
column7: Have you heard of Save the Children?
column8: It sounds familiar to me, could you tell me more about it?
column9: Helping children in countries that are very war torn or in some form of conflict is what we help in.
column10: Everyday 16,000 children die before their 5th birthday, 1 out of 80 flee the country and risk everything, and 1 out of 6 kids aren't enrolled in a school or getting education that they need
column11: The charity sounds like it is doing some good work in an area that badly needs it.
column12: Children should be our top priority all across the world.
column13: How can someone get involved and help out with this charity?
column14: Oh there are quiet a few ways.
column15: For roughly a dollar a day you can sponsor a child, you can choose a gift to spend to a child through our catalog, you could start a fundraiser, or you can just simply donate.
column16: With that, keep in mind if you ever decide to make a monetary donation, 86% goes directly to the children, 9% fundraising, and 5% management and general.
column17: Just so you can have an idea that we use 9 out of 10 dollars directly on the children.
column18: I do believe I would like to donate some money to the Save the Children charity.
column19: Could I pledge $1/day to start with?
column20: absolutely thank you so much!!
column21: I like to donate money and time to charities that help children so I also want to thank you for educating me on this charity!
column22: Absolutely.
column23: I love getting the word out there on this charity.
column24: I strongly believe in it and its values on helping children.
column25: Children should be a priority in the world.
column26: They are our future.
column27: They are our future exactly.
column28: Any time I can help improve a situation for a child in need I hope to be able to do so.
column29: How long have you been supporting this charity?
column30: I have been supporting this charity for 15 years.
column31: I also must clarify with you about your donation, if you so choose too.
column32: Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment today.
column33: You can choose as little as $0 all the way up to all of your payment.
column34: That being said, would you still like to donate $1 to the Save the Children charity, starting to make a difference in a childs life?
column35: I would like to start making a difference today.
column36: I would want to still donate $1 to the Save the Children charity.
column37: Thank you!
column38: That makes my heart so happy.
column39: Did you know in the first two months of 2018 alone, over 1,000 children were killed or injured seriously by violence in Syria?
column40: Just know that your donation today, and hopefully the start of more to come, will help children like this.
column41: I hate hearing about children being subjected to violence.
column42: It hurts my heart.
column43: I do hope I can help and that my small donation does some good for a child.
column45: Well that sounds just great to me!
column46: Thank you once again for your donation and feel free to spread the word about the charity to others!
column47: You are welcome and thank you for bringing my attention to such a well deserved charity!
